options.title: Civil Engineering
options.description: Complete the following course and Civil and Environmental Engineering M20 or Computer Science 31:

options.title: Civil Engineering M20 or Computer Science 31
courses: C&EE M20 - Introduction to Computer Programming with MATLAB
COM SCI 31 - Introduction to Computer Science I

options.title: Mathematics
options.description: Complete the following five courses and Mathematics 33B or Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering 82:

options.title: Mathematics 33B or Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering 82
Physics
courses: PHYSICS 1A - Physics for Scientists and Engineers: Mechanics
PHYSICS 1B - Physics for Scientists and Engineers: Oscillations, Waves, Electric and Magnetic Fields
PHYSICS 1C - Physics for Scientists and Engineers: Electrodynamics, Optics, and Special Relativity
PHYSICS 4AL - Physics Laboratory for Scientists and Engineers: Mechanics

options.title: Natural Science
courses: C&EE 58XP - Climate Change, Water Quality, and Ecosystem Functioning
EPS SCI 15 - Blue Planet: Introduction to Oceanography
EPS SCI 16 - Major Events in History of Life
EPS SCI 17 - Dinosaurs and Their Relatives
EPS SCI 20 - Natural History of Southern California
MIMG 5 - Science of Memory and Learning
NEUROSC 10 - Brain Made Simple: Neuroscience for 21st Century

json_data.title: The Major
json_data.description: Complete 23 courses as follows: 12 required courses, three technical breadth courses, and at least eight field elective courses.

options.title: Required
options.description: Complete 12 courses: 7 required courses and one course from each of the five options as follows:
courses: C&EE 103 - Applied Numerical Computing and Modeling in Civil and Environmental Engineering
C&EE 108 - Introduction to Mechanics of Deformable Solids
C&EE 153 - Introduction to Environmental Engineering Science

options.title: Chemical Engineering 102A or Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering 105A
Civil Engineering 91 or Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering 101
courses: MECH&AE 101 - Statics and Strength of Materials

options.title: Civil Engineering C104 or Materials Science and Engineering 104
courses: C&EE C104 - Structure, Processing, and Properties of Civil Engineering Materials
MAT SCI 104 - Science of Engineering Materials

options.title: Civil Engineering 107 or Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering 103
Civil Engineering 110 or C111
courses: C&EE 110 - Introduction to Probability and Statistics for Engineers
C&EE C111 - Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence for Civil Engineering

options.title: Technical breadth courses
options.description: Complete three technical breadth courses (12 units) selected from an approved list available in the Office of Academic and Student Affairs.

options.title: Field Electives
options.description: Select at least eight major field elective courses (32 units) from the lists below with at least two design courses, one of which must be a capstone design course and two of which must be laboratory courses. The laboratory courses must be taken from two distinct areas (both 120L and 129L may be taken to satisfy the two-laboratory requirement). Courses applied toward the required course requirement may not also be applied toward the major field elective requirement.

options.title: Civil Engineering Materials
courses: C&EE C104 - Structure, Processing, and Properties of Civil Engineering Materials
C&EE C105 - Structure and Properties of Amorphous Civil Engineering Materials
C&EE C106 - Modeling and Simulation of Civil Engineering Materials
C&EE C111 - Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence for Civil Engineering
C&EE C182 - Rigid and Flexible Pavements: Design, Materials, and Serviceability

options.title: Environmental Engineering
courses: C&EE 154 - Chemical Fate and Transport in Aquatic Environments
C&EE 155 - Unit Operations and Processes for Water and Wastewater Treatment
C&EE M165 - Environmental Nanotechnology: Implications and Applications

options.title: Structural Engineering and Mechanics
courses: C&EE 132 - Dynamics of Rigid and Flexible Structures
C&EE M135C - Introduction to Finite Element Methods
C&EE 142 - Design of Reinforced Concrete Structures

options.title: Transportation Engineering
courses: C&EE C181 - Traffic Engineering Systems: Operations and Control
C&EE C182 - Rigid and Flexible Pavements: Design, Materials, and Serviceability
